private key Verification of the public key Verification of the certificate Verification of the CSR Check the private key and the certificate are match Check the private key and the CSR are match Tool: secure-delete Secure delete with shred Secure delete with scrub Secure delete with badblocks Secure delete with secure-delete Tool: dd Show dd status every so often Redirect output to a file with dd Tool: gpg Export public key - export all keys from all keyrings or specific key - create ASCII armored output Encrypt file - encrypt data - encrypt for specific <username> Decrypt file - use as output file - decrypt data default Search recipient - set specific key server - search for keys on a key server List all of the packets in an encrypted file Tool: system-other Reboot system from init Init system from single user mode Show current working directory of a process Show actual pathname of the executed command Tool: curl - show response headers only - insecure connection when using ssl - silent mode not display body - follow redirects - set method - set user-agent - set proxy server - write output to file - resume the transfer Find your external IP address external services Repeat URL request Check DNS and HTTP trace with headers for specific domains Tool: httpie - print request and response headers - request headers - request body - response headers - response body - follow redirects - skip SSL verification - set proxy server Tool: ssh Escape Sequence Compare a remote file with a local file SSH connection through host in the middle Run command over SSH on remote host Get public key from private key Get all fingerprints SSH authentication with user password SSH authentication with publickey Simple recording SSH session Using Keychain for SSH logins SSH login without processing any login scripts SSH local port forwarding Example 1: Example 2: - redirects stdin from - do not execute a remote command - disable pseudo-terminal allocation SSH remote port forwarding Tool: linux-dev Testing remote connection to port - set protocol tcp/udp - set remote host - set destination port Read and write to TCP or UDP sockets with common bash tools Tool: tcpdump Filter incoming on interface traffic specific <ip:port> - don't convert addresses will not resolve hostnames or ports - print the link-level headers - set interface - choose send/receive direction - for old tcpdump versions - set host, also - set logic - set port number, also Filter incoming on interface traffic specific <ip:port> and write to a file - capture only num number of packets - write packets to file, - reading from file Capture all ICMP packets Check protocol used TCP or UDP for service Display ASCII text to parse the output using grep or other Grab everything between two keywords Grab user and pass ever plain http Extract HTTP User Agent from HTTP request header Capture only HTTP GET and POST packets or simply: Rotate capture files - pcap will be created every seconds - close the current pcap and open a new one if is larger than Top hosts by packets Excludes any RFC 1918 private address Tool: tcpick Analyse packets in real-time Tool: ngrep - set interface - set hostname - set port number - filter by ip or hostname - filter by port number - quiet mode only payloads - added timestamps - save output to file, - reading from file - show http headers - set protocol - set direction for specific node - stdout line buffered - case-insensitive search Tool: hping3 - verbose mode - set destination port - set source port - set scan type - set FIN flag, port open if no reply - set SYN flag - set PUSH flag - set ACK flag use when ping is blocked, RST response back if the port is open - set URG flag - set Y unused flag 0x80 - nullscan, port open if no reply - set TCP sequence number and scan type URG+PUSH+FIN, port open if no reply - packet count - set ICMP mode - set icmp type default icmp-echo = 8 - sent packets as fast as possible don't show replies - random source address mode - data size - winsize default 64 Tool: nmap Ping scans the network Show only open ports Full TCP port scan using with service version detection Nmap scan and pass output to Nikto Recon specific ip:service with Nmap NSE scripts stack Tool: netcat - listen for an incoming connection - listening after client has disconnected - save receive data to file optional - send data to remote host - verbose output - scan for listening daemons - scan only udp ports Transfer data file archive Launch remote shell Simple file server Simple minimal HTTP Server Simple HTTP Server > Restarts web server after each request - remove condition for only single connection. - port number Simple HTTP Proxy single connection Create a single-use TCP or UDP proxy Tool: gnutls-cli Testing connection to remote host with SNI support Testing connection to remote host without SNI support Tool: socat Testing remote connection to port - standard input STDIO - set tcp4 connection with specific params - set hostname/ip - set port number Redirecting TCP-traffic to a UNIX domain socket under Linux - set tcp listen with specific params - set port number - set bind hostname/ip - allows other sockets to bind to an address - keeps the parent process attempting to produce more connections - set user - ip range - communicates with the specified peer socket - define socket Tool: p0f Set iface in promiscuous mode and dump traffic to the log file - listen on the specified interface - set interface in promiscuous mode - fork into background - output file Tool: netstat Graph of connections for each hosts Monitor open connections for specific port including listen, count and sort it per IP Grab banners from local IPv4 listening ports Tool: rsync Rsync remote data as root using sudo Tool: host Resolves the domain name using external dns server Checks the domain administrator SOA record Tool: dig Resolves the domain name short output Lookup NS record for specific domain Query only answer section Query ALL DNS Records DNS Reverse Look-up Tool: certbot Generate multidomain certificate Generate wildcard certificate Generate certificate with 4096 bit private key Tool: network-other Get all subnets for specific AS Autonomous system Resolves domain name from dns.google.com with curl and jq Tool: git Log alias for a decent view of your repo Tool: python Static HTTP web server Static HTTP web server with SSL support Encode base64 Decode base64 Tool: awk Search for matching lines Search non matching lines Print matching lines with numbers Print the last column Find all the lines longer than 80 characters Print only lines of less than 80 characters Print double new lines a file Print line numbers Print line numbers for only non-blank lines Print the line and the next two i=5 lines after the line matching regexp Print the lines starting at the line matching 'server ' until the line matching '' Print multiple columns with separators Remove empty lines Delete trailing white space spaces, tabs Delete leading white space Remove duplicate consecutive lines Remove duplicate entries in a file without sorting Exclude multiple columns Substitute foo for bar on lines matching regexp Add some characters at the beginning of matching lines Get the last hour of Apache logs Tool: sed Print a specific line from a file Remove a specific line from a file Remove a range of lines from a file Replace newlines with a space - create a label - append the next line to the pattern space - if not the last line, ba branch go to label - substitute, regex for new line, by a space, global match as many times as it can Alternatives: Delete string +N next lines Tool: grep Search for a "pattern" inside all files in the current directory Show only for multiple patterns Except multiple patterns Show data from file without comments Show data from file without comments and new lines Show strings with a dash/hyphen Remove blank lines from a file and save output to new file Tool: perl Search and replace in place Edit of files changing all foo to bar and backup original Prints the first 20 lines from files Search lines 10 to 20 Delete first 10 lines and backup original Delete all but lines between foo and bar and backup original Reduce multiple blank lines to a single line Convert tabs to spaces 1t = 2sp Read input from a file and report number of lines and characters Shell Tricks &nbsp;<sup>TOC</sup>anger-table-of-contents When you get a shell, it is generally not very clean, but after following these steps, you will have a fairly clean and comfortable shell to work with. 1 2 Ctrl-Z to send it to background 3 returns the shell to foreground 4 to reset terminal 5 when asked for terminal type 6 Shell functions &nbsp;<sup>TOC</sup>anger-table-of-contents Table of Contents - Domain resolve - Get ASN Domain resolve Example: Get ASN Example:
